00022 // this routine holds image processing routines that handle some blemish-related
00023 // morphological operations
00024 
00025 //
00026 #include "algorithm/artifact/morphology.h"
00027 //
00028 #include <algorithm>
00029 
00030 using namespace std;
00031 
00032 //////////
00033 
00034 inline long xhash(int i,int j,int Xdim,int Ydim){
00035   return(j*Xdim+i);
00036 }
00037 
00038 void manhattan_transfer(std::vector<int> &BlemishMap, int Xdim, int Ydim){
00039         int MD=Xdim+Ydim;
00040         long tk;
00041     // northwest->southeast
00042         // array consists only of zeros and 1s to start with
00043         int i,j;
00044 
00045         //Take out the if/else in the inner loop because they're slow
00046         //Use the hash implicitly in address
00047         j=0;
00048         i=0;
00049         tk=0;
00050         // northwest corner is where we start, has no neighbors
00051         if (BlemishMap[tk]==1)
00052                 BlemishMap[tk]=0;
00053         else
00054                 BlemishMap[tk] = MD;
00055         // north row has no north neighbors
00056         for (i=1; i<Xdim; i++){
00057                 tk=xhash(i,j,Xdim,Ydim);
00058                 if (BlemishMap[tk]==1){
00059                         BlemishMap[tk] =0;
00060                 }else{
00061                         BlemishMap[tk] = MD;
00062                         BlemishMap[tk] = min(BlemishMap[tk],BlemishMap[tk-1]+1);
00063                 }
00064         }
00065 
00066         // west column has no west neigbors
00067         i=0; 
00068         for (j=1; j<Ydim; j++){
00069                 tk = xhash(i,j,Xdim,Ydim);
00070                 if (BlemishMap[tk]==1){
00071                         BlemishMap[tk]=0;
00072                 } else {
00073                         BlemishMap[tk] = MD;
00074                         BlemishMap[tk] = min(BlemishMap[tk], BlemishMap[tk-Xdim]+1);
00075                 }
00076         }
00077         
00078 
00079     for (i=1; i<Xdim; i++){
00080         for (j=1; j<Ydim; j++){
00081                 tk=xhash(i,j,Xdim,Ydim);
00082             if (BlemishMap[tk] == 1){
00083                 BlemishMap[tk] = 0;
00084             } else {
00085                 BlemishMap[tk] = MD;
00086                 // westward neighbor
00087                 BlemishMap[tk] = min(BlemishMap[tk], BlemishMap[tk-1]+1);
00088                 // northward neighbor
00089                 BlemishMap[tk] = min(BlemishMap[tk], BlemishMap[tk-Xdim]+1);
00090             }
00091         }
00092     }
00093     // southeast->northwest
00094 // array consists of distances to nearest blemish in north or west
00095 
00096     // same unrolling to take out if/else switch in the loop
00097     i=Xdim-1;
00098     j=Ydim-1;
00099     // southeast corner has no neighbors, so nothing to be done
00100     // Proceed along south row looking at east neighbor
00101     for (i=Xdim-2; i>=0; i--){
00102             tk = xhash(i,j,Xdim,Ydim);
00103             // east neighbor
00104             BlemishMap[tk] = min(BlemishMap[tk], BlemishMap[tk+1]+1);
00105     }
00106     // proceed along east column looking at south neighbor
00107     i = Xdim-1;
00108     for (j=Ydim-2; j>=0; j--){
00109             tk = xhash(i,j,Xdim,Ydim);
00110             BlemishMap[tk] = min(BlemishMap[tk], BlemishMap[tk+Xdim]+1);
00111         }
00112 
00113     for (i=Xdim-2; i>=0; i--){
00114         for (j=Ydim-2; j>=0; j--){
00115                 tk = xhash(i,j,Xdim,Ydim);
00116                 // where is the closest blemish?
00117             // either what we had on the first pass
00118             // east neighbor
00119                 BlemishMap[tk] = min(BlemishMap[tk], BlemishMap[tk+1]+1);
00120             // west neighbor
00121                 BlemishMap[tk] = min(BlemishMap[tk], BlemishMap[tk+Xdim]+1);
00122         }
00123     }
00124 }
00125 
00126 // invert below/above threshold
00127 void invert(std::vector<int> &BlemishMap,int k){
00128         for (long tk=0; tk<BlemishMap.size(); tk++){
00129             BlemishMap[tk] = ((BlemishMap[tk]<=k)?1:0);
00130         }
00131    }
00132 
00133 // dilate the BlemishMap by k efficiently
00134 void dilate(std::vector<int> &BlemishMap, int Xdim, int Ydim, int k){
00135     manhattan_transfer(BlemishMap,Xdim,Ydim);
00136     invert(BlemishMap,k);
00137 }
00138 
00139 // erode the BlemishMap by k by inverting the map
00140 void erode(std::vector <int> &BlemishMap, int Xdim, int Ydim, int k){
00141         invert(BlemishMap,0);
00142         dilate(BlemishMap,Xdim,Ydim,k);
00143         invert(BlemishMap,0);   
00144 }
00145 
00146 /// put this here for now
00147 //
00148 void dc_block(std::vector<float> &res, int Xdim, int Ydim, int k){
00149         // kxk block impulse filtering
00150         
00151         vector<double> tmpc,tmpcr; 
00152 
00153         tmpc.assign(res.size(),0);
00154         tmpcr.assign(res.size(),0);
00155         int i,j, curpos, rpos, xb,yb,kx;
00156         double impulse;
00157         kx = 2*k+1;
00158 
00159         // logic does not work for k=0
00160         // running sum down columns
00161         for (i=0; i<Xdim; i++){
00162                 curpos = i;
00163                 tmpc[curpos] = res[curpos];
00164                 for (j=1; j<kx; j++){
00165                         curpos = curpos + Xdim;
00166                         tmpc[curpos] = res[curpos] + tmpc[curpos-Xdim];
00167                 }
00168                 for (j=kx; j<Ydim; j++){
00169                         curpos = curpos + Xdim;
00170                         tmpc[curpos] = res[curpos] + tmpc[curpos-Xdim]-res[curpos-kx*Xdim];
00171                 }
00172         }
00173         // running sum across rows
00174         for (j=0; j<Ydim; j++){
00175                 curpos = Xdim*j;
00176                 tmpc[curpos] = tmpc[curpos];
00177                 for (i=1; i<kx; i++){
00178                         curpos = curpos+1;
00179                         tmpcr[curpos] = tmpc[curpos] + tmpcr[curpos-1];
00180                 }
00181                 for (i=kx; i<Xdim; i++){
00182                         curpos = curpos+1;
00183                         tmpcr[curpos] = tmpc[curpos] + tmpcr[curpos-1] - tmpc[curpos-kx];
00184                 }
00185         }
00186         // now tmpcr has 2k+1x2k+1 block information in running sums
00187         int den = kx*kx; // we'll be using this a lot
00188 
00189         // dc_impulse = kxk sum - current item / (k*k-1)
00190         for (j=0; j<Ydim; j++){
00191                 yb = min(max(j-k,0)+2*k,Ydim-1);
00192                 for (i=0; i<Xdim; i++){
00193                         xb = min(max(i-k,0)+2*k,Xdim-1);
00194                         rpos = xhash(i,j,Xdim,Ydim);
00195                         // running sum minus div item = mean residual
00196                         impulse = (tmpcr[xhash(xb,yb,Xdim,Ydim)]) / den;
00197                         // local residual average, to be divided out - exactly the res if k=0
00198                         res[rpos] =  impulse;
00199                 }
00200         }
00201 }
